parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The improper installation of the judder spring can cause the clutch to fail, leading to loss of control and increased risk of accidents, especially in hazardous driving conditions.
symptoms: Clutch failure
loud engine noise
transmission slipping or disengaging
vehicle hesitation or stalling
difficulty shifting gears.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The transmission slipping or disengaging can cause the vehicle to lose power and momentum, leading to loss of control and increased risk of accidents, especially when accelerating or merging.
symptoms: Transmission slips or disengages
loud engine noise
vehicle hesitation or stalling
difficulty shifting gears.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: A fractured intake valve can cause the engine to stall or run rough, leading to a loss of power and potentially causing an accident. This can also lead to costly repairs and potentially damage other engine components.
symptoms: Abnormal clattering or knocking noise from the engine
engine stalling
loss of power
rough engine idle.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Engine stalling can cause a loss of power and potentially lead to an accident, especially if it occurs while driving at high speeds. This can also lead to costly repairs and potentially damage other engine components.
symptoms: Engine stalling
loss of power
rough engine idle
difficulty starting the engine.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The front end wobble can cause loss of control, accidents, and crashes, especially at high speeds, which can lead to serious injuries or fatalities.
symptoms: The front end of the motorcycle wobbles or shakes violently
especially when hands are taken off the handlebars
making it difficult to control the vehicle.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the fork stem bearing can cause the front end wobble, leading to loss of control, accidents, and crashes, especially at high speeds, which can lead to serious injuries or fatalities.
symptoms: The front end of the motorcycle wobbles or shakes violently
especially when hands are taken off the handlebars
making it difficult to control the vehicle.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The front steering wobble can cause loss of control, accidents, and rider discomfort, particularly at speeds between 35-45 mph.
symptoms: The handlebars oscillate back and forth
the front steering wobbles
the wobble is more pronounced when relaxing grip on the handlebars
the wobble can be felt but is not severe when holding onto the handlebars.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Design Flaw in Front Steering System
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The design flaw in the front steering system can cause a wobble, leading to loss of control, accidents, and rider discomfort.
symptoms: The front steering wobbles
the handlebars oscillate back and forth
the wobble is more pronounced when relaxing grip on the handlebars
the wobble can be felt but is not severe when holding onto the handlebars.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Inaccurate speedometer and odometer readings can lead to unsafe driving conditions, as the rider may be unaware of their actual speed, which can increase the risk of accidents. Additionally, inaccurate odometer readings can affect the vehicle's maintenance schedule and resale value.
symptoms: Speedometer and odometer readings are higher than actual speed and mileage
speedometer and odometer readings are inconsistent
speedometer and odometer readings are not accurate.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The manufacturer's tolerance for inaccuracy in speedometer and odometer readings can lead to a lack of accountability for ensuring the accuracy of these critical safety features, potentially putting riders at risk.
symptoms: Manufacturer refuses to repair or replace speedometer and odometer
manufacturer claims inaccuracy is within tolerance
manufacturer does not provide accurate speed and mileage readings.
